page.title: 16Media Coverage in Northill
page.content: National and some local{newspapers}are delivered on request by a newsagent, & three free newspapers are distributed to each home in the main village by local agents who receive a small wage. Most homes have{radios}and/or hi-fi stereo systems plus colour{televisions able to take the four channels broad- cast via the Sandy Heath transmitter, clearly visible from the area. A minority utilise a viewdata service, more own or rent a{video recorder. A{guide book}tracing the Church's history is on sale for visitors, and a monthly{Parish Magazine,}cost Â£2.00 yearly, is edited & collated by Church members, but is used as the medium for circulating most village news items. A{library van}visits once a fortnight, & the{mobile information bureau}of the Rural Community Council has begun to call during the Summer, 1985.
